com.redhat.rhn.manager.configuration
Class ConfigurationValidation

java.lang.Object
  com.redhat.rhn.manager.configuration.ConfigurationValidation

public class ConfigurationValidation
extends java.lang.Object

ConfigurationValidation Holds methods for validating a variety of configuration-related fields/values

Method Detail

validateContent

public static ValidatorResult validateContent(java.lang.String content,
                                              java.lang.String macroStart,
                                              java.lang.String macroEnd)
Validate incoming content. This attempts to do macro-substitution and complains bitterly if it runs into problems:
  • Can't find a function-name between the delimiters
  • Don't like the function-name between the delimiters
  • Don't like the arguments passed to the function-name between the delimiters
Returns an error list. An element is a Map with keys "key", "arg0", "arg1", "arg2". The map values are used to I18N the resulting error message.

Parameters:
content - content of a TEXT config-file
macroStart - start macro
macroEnd - end macro
Returns:
ValidatorResult. These will be reasons why this content didn't pass. if result.isEmpty() - everything is OK

validatePath

public static ValidatorResult validatePath(java.lang.String path)
Validate config-file pathname. The rules are pretty basic:
  • MUST start with '/'
  • CANNOT end with a '/'
  • CANNOT be relative - no '..' anywhere
That's it.

Parameters:
path - pathname to be validated
Returns:
a Validator Result.

validateUGID

public static boolean validateUGID(java.lang.String in)
Validate a user- or group-ID. Tests that it's a valid Linux u/gid (positive int)

Parameters:
in - string to be tested
Returns:
true if valid, false otherwise

validateUserOrGroup

public static boolean validateUserOrGroup(java.lang.String in)
Validate a user- or group-NAME. Tests that it's a valid Linux name (starts w/alpha, followed by alphanumeric_-)

Parameters:
in - string to be tested
Returns:
true if valid, false otherwise
